programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.

programme.title: BLACK GIRL IN PARIS
programme.desc: When a down on her luck aspiring writer runs out of money after moving to Paris, she meets a street-smart prostitute who takes her on a whirlwind adventure of passion, self-discovery and uninhibited sexual freedom.

programme.title: LadyLike
programme.desc: Ladylike is a short film collaboration between Tiffany Johnson and Nicholas Williams, two best friends who met a decade ago in film school. Directed by Tiffany and co-written with Nicholas, Ladylike is a modern day noir that follows Vaughan and Harlan, two vintage vixens who have a penchant for retroâ€¦ and retribution. Not only are they bosom buddies, Vaughan and Harlanâ€™s disturbing pastime makes them a gruesome twosome.

programme.title: HAIR THAT MOVES
programme.desc: Upon entering a singing competition to pay for her travels to school, a 10-year old girl tries all she can to get her short, afro to wave in the wind like her favorite pop star's hair.

programme.title: MANGO WARS
programme.desc: Mango Wars, a comedy set in present day Kingston, Jamaica, follows Mr. Brown who runs a mango jelly business with his pregnant wife, Mrs. Brown. Fed up with the theft of mangoes from his mango tree and the impending birth of his first child, he develops an elaborate plan to catch the thief red handed. But when all of the traps are set off by unlikely elements, Mr. Brown has to rethink what really matters.

programme.title: THE BEAST
programme.desc: An ordinary day at a Zulu cultural village. Shaka, their star performer, expresses his frustrations to his co-workers as he sits on display for tourists. On this day he reaches the end of his tether and his protest takes on Shakespearian proportion.

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 1
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 2
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 3
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 4
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: FOR THE CAUSE
programme.desc: Mirai Scott, a civil rights attorney in Chicago, defends her estranged father, a former Black Panther, against a 30-year-old attempted murder charge. Long-held hostilities and accusations explode as Mirai aggressively pursues her fatherâ€™s defense.

programme.title: BROTHERS HYPNOTIC
programme.desc: For the eight young men in the Hypnotic Brass Ensemble, 'brotherhood' is literal: they're all sons of anti-establishment jazz legend, Phil Cohran.

programme.title: Upper Hand
programme.desc: Upper Hand dives into the nuanced challenges Black and brown communities have faced in finding their pathway into the new economy by way of technology access, skill development, and opportunity. Data journalist and author, Sherrell Dorsey, follows the thread of her grandfather's story, growing up in the Jim Crow south, his migration to Seattle, and how he leveraged a job in technology to lay the foundation for his family's economic future.

programme.title: THE BLACK MOZART IN CUBA
programme.desc: The Black Mozart in Cuba is the latest act in the rehabilitation of the memory of this extraordinary human being.

programme.title: KASITA
programme.desc: When little Luna canâ€™t keep the dog sheâ€™s rescued, she knows just what to do. Together with her cousin, Sol, she sets off to house the dog in one of the empty old huts that held enslaved Africans on Bonaire. Things donâ€™t go as planned

programme.title: LITTLE MUSIC MANCHILD: THE STORY OF MALIK KOFI
programme.desc: The story follows an 11-year old African American Birmingham native, child prodigy who plays the cello.

programme.title: Nothing But The Truth
programme.desc: Joseph, a troubled young gang member who participated in the countrywide violence is drawn to Anne and her farm seemingly in search of redemption. Both he and Anne need something that only the other can give to allow them to shed the painful memories of their past and move on â€“ but will either of them find it?

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 1 KoriH
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 2 Jarrod Anderson
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 3 illyIG
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 6 Chefleen Interview
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 7 MarK Clennon
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 8 Dominatrix-Queen Amazon
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 10 Kam Dussepalooza
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: VEVE
programme.desc: VEVE follows the lives of multiple characters trying to find themselves in a world of political intrigue, revenge, love and longings for success complemented by the background of the thriving yet unregulated veve business.

programme.title: MONA
programme.desc: In June 1973, a week before the Portuguese Prime Minister, Dr Ribeiro, is due to arrive in London for a state visit, protests all over the city are growing due to Portugal's harsh foreign policy in its colony of Mozambique.

programme.title: BLACK MUSEUM
programme.desc: Through interviews and observation, Director Oliver Hardt, who frequently addresses black history and culture with a strong emphasis on architecture, takes us through the remarkable physical spaces, the palpable engagement of museum visitors, and gives us insight into the challenges faced during the design process. The success of the project serves as a reminder that design and advanced storytelling can challenge the dominant political discourse and enable a diverse conversation.

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: Abused and neglected, Kellee attempts to run away with her boyfriend James, only to be chased and cornered by her abusive stepfather. What follows is a series of events that leads to a violent confrontation with the abusive man who terrorizes her life.

programme.title: SiDiKi
programme.desc: SiDiKi is an inspiring feature-length documentary about a man who--despite his physical limitations--found peace in dancing and guiding others toward the same healing. This film will change the way you view those labeled as disabled.

programme.title: Jerusa's Day â€śo Dia De Jerusaâ€ť
programme.desc: The Day of Jerusa' narrates the encounter between Jerusa a resident of an old townhouse of Bixiga with the young Silvia which circulates through the traditional SĂŁo Paulo neighborhood doing opinion research on soap in powder.

programme.title: CHASING REFUGE
programme.desc: A selfish young man must reconcile his feelings of guilt and remorse when his estranged half-brother commits suicide.

programme.title: RIGAMO
programme.desc: In the midst of family loss and tragedy 6-year-old Kera Moore discovers she has the power to bring people back to life with her tears. However she quickly learns this gift requires an incredible sacrifice.

programme.title: DARATT
programme.desc: When the government announces an amnesty for all war criminals, 16-year-old Atim's grandfather gives him a revolver and tells him to find his father's killer. The teenager loses no time in tracking him down.
